I had an uncle in the 1st MarDiv.
The Chinese had decided that the destruction of the 1st MarDiv at Chosen would be a great propaganda victory.
The Chinese threw several divisions against 1st MarDiv.
The Chinese did force the fighting withdrawal of 1st MarDiv which due to poor high command decisions by Gen Ned Almond had been pushed too far forward without adequate flank protection and disregarding evidence of the infiltration of an initial surge of 300 000 Chibese troops across the Talu.
Fortunately Gen OP Smith one of the best Generals of that period was in command of 1st MarDiv.
He had provided for a line of withdrawal as well as an airfield for resupply.
It wasn't pretty or pleasant.
But 1st MarDiv extricate itself from the Chinese enveloping bring out its wounded dead and heavy equipment.
I'm sure the Chinese propaganda movie presents the battle as a huge victory for the PLA.
In fact it was not as Maos objective of the destruction of 1st MsrDiv was not accomplished although an army unit at the Re s Ivor was essentially destroyed with some survivors being rescued and brought out by 1st MarDiv.
With the arrival of Ridgeway as the commander of the allied forces in Korea the situation stabilized and the Chinese began being forced back.
Ridgeway was given orders to stabilize the front at the e8th parallel which he did.
The Chinese human wave attacks were met by well dug in troops and massive firepower.
Best estimates are that Chinese losses in the war were around 600 000 troops on top of the NK losses of at least 350 000.
The US lost 53. 000 killed 
South Korea was saved. The 1st Mar Div fights the US battles today with success and honor.
South Korea is a successful and prosperous country.
North Korea is poor dark at night and had nuclear we a Pons thanks to china and Pakistan.
The Chinese tactics in Korea were not after the initial surprise particularly successful and were wasteful of their soldiers lives. These soldiers were poorly equipped for the weather and suffer greatly from freezing to death and frostbite.
And THAT is more or less a summary of the Korean War and the outcome.
From the Chinese standpoint it's hardly the stuff of which legends are made although their individual soldiers were cert as only brave enough.
